data.title: Linda Ronstadt
data.meta_description: News about Linda Ronstadt, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
5 favorite places

Linda Ronstadt’s Tucson

The Rock & Roll Hall of Famer known for hits like “Blue Bayou” and “Long Long Time” recommends spots she adores in the city where she was born and raised.

By Abbie Kozolchyk

How Peter Asher, a Jack-of-all-Trades in Music, Mastered Them All

The British musician, manager, producer, executive and author known for his work with Linda Ronstadt and James Taylor, is the subject of a new book exploring his unique run in the industry.

By Bob Mehr

For Her Swan Song, Linda Ronstadt Turns to Recipes

In “Feels Like Home,” the singer, her voice taken by a form of Parkinson’s, tells her story through the border dishes of her Arizona youth.

By Kim Severson

Linda Ronstadt, Retired From Singing, Is Still a Glorious Voice

The 73-year-old is the subject of a new documentary and a Kennedy Center honoree. She’s also as self-effacing and gutsy as ever.

By Jim Farber

critic’s pick

‘Linda Ronstadt: The Sound of My Voice’ Review: And What a Voice It Is

The career of a vocalist who sang every kind of song that’s ever been made.

By A.O. Scott
